subject: Programming
title: The 2010 Flash Crash
description: A fast breakdown of The 2010 Flash Crash for builders.

hook.text: On May 6, 2010, the Dow Jones dropped nearly 1,000 points in minutes, then bounced back.

buildup.text: High-frequency trading algorithms detected selling pressure and amplified it at machine speed.

discovery.text: One large sell order triggered a feedback loop among thousands of automated trading bots.

twist.text: Procter & Gamble stock briefly traded at one cent. Accenture dropped to a penny per share.

climax.text: A trillion dollars in market value vanished and returned within 20 minutes.

punchline.text: Algorithms panicked faster than humans ever could.

quiz.question: What caused the 2010 Flash Crash?
options: A feedback loop among trading algorithms
A power outage at the stock exchange
